ovdesc.p: This file defines the defaults and validation to be used for teller transactions.
It defines the accounts to be used for both sides of the transaction, the charges to be applied (if any) the transaction codes, currency markets etc.

This field is used to split the charges and tax amounts as separate entries, from the credit or debit transaction amount of the account to which the charges and tax are attached.
If 'YES' is defined in this field, the system will generate separate accounting entries for the charges and taxes attached to the credit or debit transaction, instead of netting them.
If 'YES' is not defined and left blank, the charge/ tax amount will be adjusted with the respective debit or credit transaction and accounting entry will be raised for the net amount only.
This feature is not available for transactions done through Multi -line Teller.
Example:
A cash deposit in a customer account of USD10000 has a charge of USD100 and tax of USD10.
If SPLIT.CHRG.ENTRIES is defined as YES, the following accounting entries are raised:
For CUST.AC.TRANSFER field set as 'Yes',CHG.TYPE field has DEBIT PLUS CHARGES or CREDIT LESS CHARGES and irrespective of SPLIT.CHRG.ENTRIES field set as 'Yes' or 'No',
If Third Account(i.e.Other than ACCOUNT.1 or ACCOUNT.2) used as Charge Account in TELLER transaction, system will create a seperate entry for Charges
The debit of USD100 for charges and USD10 for tax can be combined into a single debit as USD110, by using the combine transaction feature of TRANSACTION, as explained below.
If SPLIT.CHRG.ENTRIES were left blank, the entries would be raised as below:
In COMBINE.TXN field, along with other TRANSACTION codes that are to be combined with this selected TRANSACTION, the ID of this selected TRANSACTION code also is to be mentioned.

Validation rules:
This is an optional field.
Specifies the Default category to post side 1 entry.
This determines the internal account number or the P&L category to which the side 1 amount will be posted.
If side 1 is defined as customer (see VALID.ACCOUNTS) then this field must be blank.
The internal account is determined using currency, category and department account officer. If the dept.acct.officer is blank then the teller id is used instead.

The department account officer can also be in the format NN99. In this case the internal account is constructed using currency, category, the first two digits of the teller id and 99. Any number of digits can be defaulted in this way. This facility can be used to support branch specific tills without the need to set up individual TELLER.TRANSACTIONS for each branch.
If the entry is posted to a P&L category then the DEPT.ACCT.OFFICER code is inserted into the account officer field of the entry.
9 Numeric characters consisting of: 5 Numeric - CATEGORY Code 4 Numeric - optional DEPT.ACCT.OFFICER
Must be a valid entry on the CATEGORY file combined with a valid DEPT.ACCT.OFFICER (optional).
Specifies the Default category to post side 2 entry.
This determines the internal account number or the P&L category to which the side 2 amount will be posted.
If side 2 is defined as customer (see VALID.ACCOUNTS) then this field must be blank.

The internal account is determined using currency, category and department account officer. If the dept.acct.officer is blank then the teller id is used instead. The dept.acct.officer cannot be specified if the transaction is a teller transfer.
If the entry is posted to a P&L category then the DEPT.ACCT.OFFICER code is inserted into the account officer field of the entry.
9 Numeric characters consisting of: 5 Numeric - CATEGORY Code 4 Numeric - optional DEPT.ACCT.OFFICER
Must be a valid entry on the CATEGORY file combined with a valid DEPT.ACCT.OFFICER (optional).
